fr.sorbonne_u.components.pubsub.components

Class PubSubNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.pubsub.components.PubSub
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.pubsub.components.PubSubNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, PubSubService

    public class PubSubNode
extends PubSub
    A PubSubNode component acts like a local PubSub component for each host, and should only used in Distributed CVM.

    The PubSubNode is not just a PubSub, it's also a Publisher and Subscriber at the same time.

    By doing so, when a PubSubNode component is instantiated, it will subscribe to the in-bound port of a unique PubSub component (this component is unique among all the hosts), the PubSubNode Publisher component also will establish the connection between his out-bound port and the in-bound port of the unique PubSub component.

    When regular Publisher components and Subscriber components are created, they must establish a connection between their out-bound ports and this PubSubNode component in-bound port, so when a message will be published, it will pass by this PubSubNode component, the PubSubNode then will not publish the message to its subscribers, but it will forward the message the unique PubSub component, this unique PubSub component then will publish the message to all its subscribers (PubSubNodes), and so when the PubSubNode receive the message then, and only then it will publish it to its regular subscriber components

    This architecture allow us to build a tree of a PubSubNode instances whom root is a one unique PubSub component, which will maximize the concurrency when there will be a significant number of machines or Publisher , Subscriber components.

    See Also:
    PubSub
